humanum_full_description_en:
Jia, Jin, and seal scripts are all like holding the "ä¸¨" with the hand (again), and the suspect is a stone axe. In ancient times, adult men held axe for production, so they used the axe as a symbol of their parents. The original meaning was the " father " of the father . "Shuowen": "Father, Ju also. Parents lead the teacher. Cong raises the stick again." Xu Shen uses " moment " to explain " father " as a voice instruction. According to the "Shuowen", the image stick held by the hand of the word " father " is meant to be taught by holding a stick; Luo Zhenyu thinks it is like a torch according to the inscriptions; if Guo Li thinks it is like an axe, it is an " axe ". " Father " and "æ”´" are the differentiation of the word, the actor is " father ", and the small tapping action is "æ”´". All theories have their own reasons, so the above are cited together for reference.

The Oracle " father " refers to the biological father and the fathers, "Compilation" 2330: "Report to the Three Fathers", refers to the sacrifice to the three fathers. "Complete Collection" 6647 is: "Wu Yang Jia, Fu Geng, Fu Xin Yi Niu." "Fu Geng" and "Fu Xin" are the names of Shang Dynasty emperors for father or uncle. The whole sentence means not Xiangyang. A, father Xin, and father Ding performed a yor sacrifice with a cow.

" Father " in the bronze inscription also refers to the biological father and the parents. The ability to sculpt the respect: "to use the literary father's day and the Yi Bao to Zun Yi." Mao Gongding: "Wang said: "Father ğ¢‰©"", " ğ¢‰© " is the king of Zhou Elders, so Zhou Wang called it his father. Handed down documents still retain this meaning, "Dialect": "ğ ‹¢, Ai, Chang, Lao Ye. Between the Eastern Qi Lu and Wei, the elders are called ğ ‹¢, or Ai. Zhou Jin and Qin Long were called the prince, or the weng. Nanchu is called the father, or the father." The word is also used as a man's good name and place name.

The " father " in the bamboo slips of the Warring States period refers to the father, or it is a word with the " mother ", as in "Shangbo Zhushu II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 13: "filial piety (raising) parents, to be good to their new (pro)"; or with " child " to form words, such as "Shangbo Zhushu III. "Peng Zu" Jane 5: "Father and Son Brothers."

In the handed down documents, " father " is often used to refer to the father's generation, "Shi Ming. "Said Kinsman": "Father, the father is also the first to be born." "Mao Shi. Zhou Nan. "Ge Tan": "Return to Ning's parents" means going home to greet parents. It is also used as a general term for male elders, "Er Ya. "Shi Qin": "Father's test is the king's father, the father's concubine is the queen mother; the king's father's test is the great grandfather, the king's concubine is the great grandmother; the great grandfather's test is the great grandfather, the great grandfather The concubine is the emperor Wang concubine." "Zhan Guo Ce. "Han Ce II": "The enemy of the minister, the puppet of Han, and the puppet is also the father of Han Jun."

The font is easy to mix with " Yin ", see " Yin ".

["Guangyun" Helping the rain to cut, go up, and bong. ]
(1) Father.
(2) Refers to male animals that have direct blood relationship with chicks and cubs.
(3) It is said to behave like a father.
(4) Said to be treated as a father.
(5) The honorific title for the founder of a certain big cause.
(6) Refers to the root of all things metamorphosing. See "parents".
(7) The name of the emperor in ancient times for the princes with the same surname or the princes for the doctors with the same surname.
(8) Generic term for male elders of the same surname.
(9) Called the elders among in-laws. Such as uncle, uncle, etc.
(10) The name of the governor in ancient times.
(11) In the Song Dynasty, ethnic minorities such as Qiang and Xixia also honored the Han officials as "father".
